word_mean: 网络节点上话务承载装置、交换级、控制和信令设备以及其他功能单元的集合体。交换机能把用户线路、电信电路和（或）其他要互连的功能单元根据单个用户的请求连接起来。

sentence.Network_en: The spokesman implicitly condemned the United States policy switch.
sentence.Network_cn: 发言人含蓄地谴责了美国政策上的转变。

sentence.Network_en: Every time I switch on the TV, there's football. It's overkill.
sentence.Network_cn: 我每次打开电视都是足球节目，真是受不了。

sentence.Network_en: Prince Edward threw the switch to light the illuminations.
sentence.Network_cn: 爱德华王子按动开关亮起彩灯。

交换机（switch）是一种在通信系统中完成信息交换功能的设备。在计算机网络系统中，交换概念的提出是对于共享工作模式的改进。
交换器（SWITCH）上的所有端口均有独享的信道带宽，以保证每个端口上数据的快速有效传输。交换器为用户提供的是独占的、点 …

jx.jx_en_mean: To stop paying attention; lose interest.

means.word_mean: 交换;替代
鞭打
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (denoting a thin tapering riding whip): probably from Low German

encyclopedia.content: Switch是交换机，它的前身是网桥。交换机是使用硬件来完成以往网桥使用软件来完成过滤、学习和转发过程的任务。SWITCH速度比HUB快，这是由于HUB不知道目标地址在何处，发送数据到所有的端口。而SWITCH中有一张转发表，如果知道目标地址在何处，就把数据发送到指定地点，如果它不知道就发送到所有的端口。这样过滤可以帮助降低整个网络的数据传输量，提高效率。 以switch命名的还有动画以及漫画作...

entry.def: A switch is a small control for an electrical device which you use to turn the device on or off.

example.ex: Leona put some detergent into the dishwasher, shut the door and pressed the switch.
example.tran: 利昂娜将一些清洁剂放入洗碗机，关上门后按了开始键。

entry.def: If you switch to something different, for example to a different system, task, or subject of conversation, you change to it from what you were doing or saying before.

example.ex: Estonia is switching to a market economy...
example.tran: 爱沙尼亚正在向市场经济转轨。

example.ex: The law would encourage companies to switch from coal to cleaner fuels...
example.tran: 该法律将鼓励企业转而使用比煤更加清洁的能源。

entry.tran: 转移(注意力);(注意力)转变
entry.def: If you switch your attention from one thing to another or if your attention switches, you stop paying attention to the first thing and start paying attention to the second.

example.ex: My mother's interest had switched to my health...
example.tran: 母亲转而关注起我的健康来。

example.ex: As the era wore on, she switched her attention to films.
example.tran: 随着这个时代慢慢过去，她把目光投向了电影业。

entry.def: If you switch two things, you replace one with the other.

example.ex: In half an hour, they'd switched the tags on every cable...
example.tran: 半个小时内，他们就给每根电缆都换了标签。

example.ex: The ballot boxes have been switched.

means.word_mean: 1. control consisting of a mechanical or electrical or electronic device for making or breaking or changing the connections in a circuit
2. an event in which one thing is substituted for another;

sentences.sentence: "the replacement of lost blood by a transfusion of donor blood"

means.word_mean: 3. hairpiece consisting of a tress of false hair; used by women to give shape to a coiffure
4. railroad track having two movable rails and necessary connections; used to turn a train from one track to another or to store rolling stock
5. a flexible implement used as an instrument of punishment
6. a basketball maneuver; two defensive players shift assignments so that each guards the player usually guarded by the other
7. the act of changing one thing or position for another;

sentences.sentence: "his switch on abortion cost him the election"

means.word_mean: 1. change over, change around, or switch over
2. exchange or give (something) in exchange for
3. lay aside, abandon, or leave for another;

sentences.sentence: "switch to a different brand of beer"

means.word_mean: 4. make a shift in or exchange of;
5. cause to go on or to be engaged or set in operation;
6. flog with or as if with a flexible rod
7. reverse (a direction, attitude, or course of action)

list.explanation: (火箭等飞行器在飞行中发生故障时)地面控制的自动炸毁按扭
(能把宇航员或飞行员从损坏的飞行器中弹射出来的)紧急弹射按扭

example.en: She saw her child and immediately switched on.
example.zh: 她见到自己的孩子，立刻就精神百倍。

example.en: That music really switched me on!
example.zh: 那音乐真让我浑身来劲!

list.explanation: 加入新潮，参与流行趋势，时髦起来

example.en: Most kids I know switched on when they went to high school.
example.zh: 我认识的那些青年人进入了高等学府后，他们大部分人都投入了新的潮流。n'm too old to switch on.我太老了，赶不了时髦了。

list.explanation: 受毒品麻醉，变得飘飘然起来

example.en: There was some old man who seemed to get pleasure from getting kids to switch on. Maybe he was a dealer.
example.zh: 有个老头看到一些青年人被毒品麻醉得飘飘然起来好像显得很高兴。说不定他是个毒品贩子。

auth_sentence.res_content: Tell the new bank that you want to switch.

Sentence.sentence: students can switch to different discussions at any point
Large companies have a difficult time switching into new markets because there is a temptation to put existing assets into the new businesses.
Why do large companies have difficulty switching to new markets
I needed to switch my computer class to the 950 section.
Many people now say the benefits of switching to vegetarian diet which excludes meat and fish.
However, some nutritionists advise against switching to a totally strict vegetarian diet

改变, 转变

sentences.en: We had to make a switch in our arrangements.
sentences.cn: 我们不得不对我们的安排作些变动。

sentences.en: The boy made a switch from the branch of a cherry tree.
sentences.cn: 这个男孩用樱桃树枝做了一条鞭子。

means.word_mean: 转变, 改变

sentences.cn: 他们不断改变碰面的地点。

means.word_mean: 转换
鞭打；赶(牲畜等)

sentences.en: He switched the boy with a cane.
sentences.cn: 他用手杖抽打那个小孩。

means.word_mean: 挥动(棍棒、鞭子等)；甩动(尾巴等)

sentences.en: The horse swithed its tail to drive the flies away.
sentences.cn: 马甩动尾巴以驱赶苍蝇。

means.word_mean: 迅速转动，迅速移动；突然夺下

sentences.en: He switched the book from my hand.
sentences.cn: 他突然夺去我手中的书。

jushi.english: He used to smoke this brand of cigarettes, but he switched.
jushi.chinese: 他本来抽这种牌子的香烟,但他后来改抽别的牌子了。
